Stride Shading Language (SDSL) is an extension of HLSL, which makes it closer to C# syntax and concepts.

SDSL uses an original way to handle multiple inheritance.
SDSL uses an original way to handle multiple inheritance.
Inheritance is performed through mixins, so the order of inheritance is crucial:

When a method appears several times in the inheritance tree of a shader class, this keyword forces the creation of multiple instances of the method at each level of the inheritance instead of one.

Abstract methods are available in SDSL.
Abstract methods are available in SDSL.
They should be prefixed with the <g1>abstract</g1> keyword.
They should be prefixed with the <g1>abstract</g1> keyword.
You can inherit from a shader class with abstract methods without having to implement them; the compiler will simply produce a harmless warning.
